workflow.name: Fetch hierarchical data records from Airtable with multi-level relationships
workflow.description:
# Airtable Hierarchical Record Fetcher

## Description

This n8n workflow retrieves an Airtable record along with its related child records in a hierarchical structure. It can fetch up to 3 levels of linked records and assembles them into a comprehensive JSON object, making it ideal for complex data relationships and nested record structures.

## Features

- **Multi-level Record Fetching**: Retrieves parent record, linked child records (level 2), and optionally grandchild records (level 3)
- **API Call Optimization**: Uses Airtable's `filterByFormula` to minimize API calls by fetching multiple related records in single requests
- **Selective Level 3 Fetching**: Only fetches level 3 records for specified linked fields to optimize performance
- **Rich Text Processing**: Converts Airtable's pseudo-markdown rich text fields to HTML format
- **Hierarchical JSON Output**: Organizes all data in a structured, nested JSON format
- **Flexible Configuration**: Customizable depth and field selection per execution

## Input Parameters

The workflow accepts a JSON array with the following structure:

```json
[
  {
    "base_id": "appN8nPMGoLNuzUbY",
    "table_id": "tblLVOwpYIe0fGQ52", 
    "record_id": "reczMh1Pp5l94HdYf",
    "level_3": [
      "fldRaFra1rLta66cD",
      "fld3FxCaYk8AVaEHt"
    ],
    "to_html": true
  }
]
```

### Parameter Details

| Parameter | Type | Required | Description |
|-----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `base_id` | string | Yes | Airtable base identifier |
| `table_id` | string | Yes | Airtable table identifier for the main record |
| `record_id` | string | Yes | Airtable record identifier to fetch |
| `level_3` | array | No | Array of field IDs from level 2 records for which to fetch level 3 children |
| `to_html` | boolean | No | Convert rich text fields from pseudo-markdown to HTML (default: false). This requires `marked` npm package. |

## Output Structure

The workflow returns a hierarchical JSON object with the following structure:

```json
{
   "id": "recXXXXXXX",
   "field_1": ...,
   "field_2": ...,
   "level2_child": [
      {
         "id": "recXXXXXXX",
         "field_a": ...,
         "field_b": ...,
         "level3_child": [
            {
               "id": "recXXXXXXX",
               "field_y": ...,
               "field_z": ...,
            },
            ...
         ]
      },
      ...
   ]
}
```

nodes.name: Insert linked records to originRecord & Clean Field Name
Get Linked records without Link To fields Except for Level 3
Get L3 Linked records without reverse Link To fields

parameters.name: filterByFormula
parameters.value: =FIND(RECORD_ID(),"{{ $('Loop Over L2 Records for a given L1 field').item.json.fields[$json.level_2_field_name].join() }}}")

nodes.name: Repeat L3 links of current L2 table

assignments.name: level_3_links
assignments.value: ={{ $('Inputs').item.json.level_3.filter(x => $('Airtable Schema').all().filter(x => x.json.id == $('Add Inverse LinkTo Field name').item.json.options.linkedTableId)[0].json.fields.map(x => x.id).includes(x)) }}

assignments.name: level_3_table_id
assignments.value: ={{ $('Airtable Schema').all().filter(x => x.json.id == $('Add Inverse LinkTo Field name').item.json.options.linkedTableId)[0].json.fields.filter(x => x.id == $json.level_3_links)[0].options.linkedTableId }}

assignments.name: level_3_field_id
assignments.value: ={{ $('Airtable Schema').all().filter(x => x.json.id == $('Add Inverse LinkTo Field name').item.json.options.linkedTableId)[0].json.fields.filter(x => x.id == $json.level_3_links)[0].options.inverseLinkFieldId }}

assignments.name: level_2_field_name
assignments.value: ={{ $('Airtable Schema').all().filter(x => x.json.id == $('Add Inverse LinkTo Field name').item.json.options.linkedTableId)[0].json.fields.filter(x => x.id == $json.level_3_links)[0].name }}

assignments.name: fields
assignments.value: ={{ {fields: {...$('Loop Over L2 Records for a given L1 field').item.json.fields, ...$json.fields} } }}

parameters.content:
## Level 3 children

This is an iteration on each L2 records array having level 3 children to be fetched

# Airtable Hierarchical Record Fetcher

## Description

This n8n workflow retrieves an Airtable record along with its related child records in a hierarchical structure. It can fetch up to 3 levels of linked records and assembles them into a comprehensive JSON object, making it ideal for complex data relationships and nested record structures.

## Features

- **Multi-level Record Fetching**: Retrieves parent record, linked child records (level 2), and optionally grandchild records (level 3)
- **Selective Level 3 Fetching**: Only fetches level 3 records for specified linked fields to optimize performance
- **Rich Text Processing**: Converts Airtable's pseudo-markdown rich text fields to HTML format
- **Hierarchical JSON Output**: Organizes all data in a structured, nested JSON format
- **Flexible Configuration**: Customizable depth and field selection per execution

## Input Parameters

The workflow accepts a JSON array with the following structure:

```json
[
  {
    "base_id": "appN8nPMGoLNuzUbY",
    "table_id": "tblLVOwpYIe0fGQ52", 
    "record_id": "reczMh1Pp5l94HdYf",
    "level_3": [
      "fldRaFra1rLta66cD",
      "fld3FxCaYk8AVaEHt"
    ],
    "to_html": true
  }
]
```

### Parameter Details

| Parameter | Type | Required | Description |
|-----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `base_id` | string | Yes | Airtable base identifier |
| `table_id` | string | Yes | Airtable table identifier for the main record |
| `record_id` | string | Yes | Airtable record identifier to fetch |
| `level_3` | array | No | Array of field IDs from level 2 records for which to fetch level 3 children |
| `to_html` | boolean | No | Convert rich text fields from pseudo-markdown to HTML (default: false). This requires `marked` npm package. |

## Output Structure

The workflow returns a hierarchical JSON object with the following structure:

```json
{
   "id": "recXXXXXXX",
   "field_1": ...,
   "field_2": ...,
   "level2_child": [
      {
         "id": "recXXXXXXX",
         "field_a": ...,
         "field_b": ...,
         "level3_child": [
            {
               "id": "recXXXXXXX",
               "field_y": ...,
               "field_z": ...,
            },
            ...
         ]
      },
      ...
   ]
}
```

## Converts Airtable Rich Text (pseudo-markdown) to HTML
 
**This requires `marked` npm package.** 

You can delete these nodes if you don't need the feature

## Level 2 children

For each `Link to another record` fields:

- We fetch the linked records array (up to 100 children) thanks to a `filterbyformula` API trick
- In those level 2 children records, we exclude `link to another record` fields except for fields given in `level_3` workflow input

nodes.name: Loop Over L2 records arrays having L3 children to fetch
Loop Over L2 Records for a given L1 field

options.reset: ={{ $node["Loop Over L2 Records for a given L1 field"].context["done"] }}

parameters.content:
## Level 3 children

This is an iteration on each record within a record array to fetch its level 3 children

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
